title: Ticket #3855: Condor on Win32 retries forever if executable is invalid
description:
When the Windows version of the STARTER cannot execute the user's job, it will retry forever instead of putting the job on hold.

To reproduce the problem. submit this job from a Linux submit machine to a windows execute node. The job will fail, and then retry forever. 

executable = /bin/sleep
log = test.log
output = test.out
error = test.err
Requirements = OpSys=="WINDOWS" && Arch!=""
queue

The fundamental problem is that the failure to start the executable is never passed out of DaemonCore::Create_Process in a form that the starter will turn into a hold request. errno is never set, and the returned error message string is empty.
